alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 3:34PM MST until July 28 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Sawtooth and Superstition burn scar in... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 334 PM MST, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Sawtooth and Superstition Burn Scar. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell. Flash flooding is ongoing in some low lying areas. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Sawtooth and Superstition Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mesa, Apache Junction, Gold Canyon, Superstition Mountains, Kings Ranch, Gold Camp, Lost Dutchman State Park, Goldfield and Queen Valley. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
